name: Dark Souls: Artorias of the Abyss Edition
storyline:
Dark Souls employs minimalist storytelling to convey its plot and lore. Historical events in its world and their significance are often implicit or left to player interpretation rather than being fully shown or explained. Most of the story is given to the player through dialogue from non-player characters within the game, flavor text from items, and world design.

An action RPG and spiritual sequel to Demon's Souls (2009) in which the player embodies the Chosen Undead, who is tasked with fulfilling an ancient prophecy by ringing the Bells of Awakening in the dark fantasy setting of Lordran, an open world with intricate areas full of beasts, former humans gone hollow, and magical abominations whom the player must overcome in challenging and unforgiving combat.
summary: Dying once is not enough. Gamers need to be devoured repeatedly in Dark Souls before they find the way to survival. Those who think they have beaten the ultimate challenge? Think again. Because Artorias of the Abyss is coming. The developers estimate that the new content is going to last gamers ten to twenty hours, but it's hard to tell, all those demons might just give you more trouble than you can imagine. The Artorias of the Abyss chapter takes place hundreds of years ago. There are three new areas, four bosses and many new items. One of the areas is revealed to be the Black Forest. Although it's in the same location as the one in the existing game, the enemies and the buildings inside are completely different.
